actions.committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Parks, Preservation and Recreation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Parks, Historic Preservation, and Recreation

official_title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to enter into an agreement with the State of South Dakota providing for maintenance, operation, and administration by the State, on a trial basis during a period not to exceed 10 years, of 3 National Park System units in the State, and for other purposes.
short_title: South Dakota National Parks Preservation Act

summary.text: South Dakota National Parks Preservation Act - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior (Secretary), acting through the Director of the National Park Service, to enter into an appropriate form of agreement with the Secretary of the Department of Game, Fish, and Parks of South Dakota to provide for maintenance, operation, and administration of the following National Park System (NPS) units in South Dakota by the Department for a period not to exceed ten years: (1) Mount Rushmore National Memorial; (2) Wind Cave National Park; and (3) Jewel Cave National Monument. Allows the agreement to provide that: (1) the Secretary will pay the Department an annual fee in an amount not to exceed expenditures by the Secretary for maintenance, operation, and administration of the NPS units during FY 1994; and (2) if after a number of years stated in the agreement, it appears that such annual Department costs have exceeded and will continue to exceed such annual payment, the Department will be permitted to charge the public entrance fees and user fees for such NPS units in reasonable amounts agreed to by the Secretary.

titles.title: South Dakota National Parks Preservation Act

A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to enter into an agreement with the State of South Dakota providing for maintenance, operation, and administration by the State, on a trial basis during a period not to exceed 10 years, of 3 National Park System units in the State, and for other purposes.
